Reviews.Title: “Horrible rooms and no customer service”
Reviews.Author: Christina M
Reviews.Content: I originally chose this hotel because it was close to the central station but it is crap. This family run hotel does not have any customer service and unfriendly, the rooms are outdated and filthy, it is located in the ghetto part of the city. I would not recommend this hotel unless you want to be mugged. They take your room keys when you leave the hotel and no guests are allowed. Who knows who they might entering your room without permission. Horrible hotel and terrible staff.

Reviews.Title: “The worst CUSTOMER SERVICE IN THE WORLD”
Reviews.Author: lij c
Reviews.Content: Don't give your money to this hotel. This is the WORST hotle in the world. The stuffs are not very friendly. The room is dark and smelly. It's locate in the pick pocket area of Rome. Please stay away from this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget location”
Reviews.Author: Peter M Grant
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend break. Good for a budget hotel and very close to Termini station. Room was clean and bed good, excellent wifi setup (free). Some noise from the street below but not unreasonable. Breakfast well organised and pretty good by Italian standards. Lots of excellent small restaurants in the area. For a break, although it is away from the main tourist spots, it is close to Termini metro station and bus stops, a, 11 Euro three day pass allows very good access to anywhere within Rome (and even out to the Lido).

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: skyelark
Reviews.Content: Very near to Roma Termini and the different transport hubs near Termini. We arrived late at night, the streets around Termini did look a bit shabby but nothing happened to us, so I guess it's relatively safe. There are restos around the area, gelato just across the street. Rooms - rooms looked clean though a bit old. Toilet also looked a bit worn already, there were some blond hairs stuck to the faucet (not ours), and the water heater was very hard to mix (either too hot or too cold, not in-between). Room had a TV. Free wifi - need to ask for the wifi card from the front desk. Breakfast was bread, cereals, coffee and orange juice. They had jam, butter and chocolate spread. Overall, okay. It's a 2-star hotel so don't expect much, but it was clean, accessible, with free wifi and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Its OK”
Reviews.Author: Elie85
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night, and I didn't plan to sleep in Rome at that night, I had a quick look over the internet and this was the only hotel with a vacant room. The hotel location is perfect just 2 to 5 minutes walk to Termini station. Some attractions fall within the street of the hotel. There are a number of restaurants and coffee shops around, the majority of them are of low quality and relatively expensive, there are also a number of Indian, Arabic and Muslim restaurants that give the impression of low price restaurants although I didn't stop by. The neighborhood is a bit messy and is not really comfortable to walk around especially at night though nothing bad happened to me. It’s also true to say that the neighborhood is crowded and has a lot of shops around. The staff at the reception was OK and those working in the breakfast place were better. The room and its toilet were clean but a bit aging (especially the bed sheets); the size of the room was very small to a degree that you can hardly move freely inside it. The breakfast was the poorest to eat and the hotel was full of young teenage travelers who were very loud For the money I paid, I believe I would have booked in a better place. For a short period of time and if you plan to go around for lots of time and due to its good location I would then recommend taking this hotel into consideration

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, basic”
Reviews.Author: nem048
Reviews.Content: Booked through bookings.com for 2 nights after reading the reviews, wanted a room that was clean, cheap and good location - so turned out as expected. Single room at 5th floor, quiet, fan provided, simple shower area, small thin worn towel; free wi-fi given but poor signal at the 5th floor; breakfast located in small cramped room where you' re served orange juice, coffee & basket of hard bread roll - abit disappointing, but it is 2 star though so you get what you paid for. Separate key given for safe deposit which is a hole in the wall - reception guy made a point of telling me to lock up my valuables & passport before leaving the hotel & to take the key with me without the key ring of the hotel address. Guy in reception 24 hrs, no problem in walking back to hotel at night, the street has some popular restaurants, nearby convenience stores, money changer at the corner. Overall a basic clean bed for the night at reasonable rate considering the good location.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: Wind41
Reviews.Content: The hotel is simple and very clean, breakfast was more than enough with good quality products. The location is excellent only 1 street from Termini Station which is the central node to go to all main places in Rome. The Metro is there, all tourist buses are there, easy access to airports as well. They were constantly cleaning, bathrooms clean and nice, good showers, TV and Internet free. Rooms have a little vault in the wall you can use for valuables. There are supermarkets around, ice-creams and pizza across the street, etc. But the elevator looks old, but it worked well anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: SilviuAgoston
Reviews.Content: A hotel located close to Termini train station (50 meters). From the hotel to the church of Santa Maria Maggiore 10 minutes and up to 15 minute walk to the Colosseum. Rooms are small but comfortable. Unfortunately the bathroom is very small, and the radiator is too small for a cool night. However, comfort is good, rooms are cleaned daily, there are numerous television stations etc. Breakfast is typical Italian: coffee, tea, croissant, toast with butter and jam. For a day start is enough. The staff is very helpful, providing useful information to all travelers. What mattered most: I could leave the laptop in the room (room has safe but space is enough only for a wallet or a passport) and I wasn’t affraid that can be stolen. So a small but stylish hotel, located close to all means of transport, and safe for passengers goods. Since we talk about Rome, Hotel Giorgina worth more than 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent!!”
Reviews.Author: erral
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel here at tripadvisor and booked through booking.com. We booked for 3 days in agoust 3 double rooms for 270 € each. Very good value for money really!! The hotel is wonderful, big rooms, bathroom, modern TVs. The hotel has a very good location, 3 streets from Termini Station and near of everything in a short walk. The breakfast-buffet was excelent with a lot of orange-juice, coffee, tea, chocolate and a lot of buiscuits too. The hotel has free wifi service but you have to ask a code at reception-desk. Definetely a hotel where I will go if I visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Good family owned Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vforsey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a family runned business very close to the train/bus station. Our room was VERY clean and tidy. We had a huge room including one double bed and two twins. It was only 65 Euro. Included breakfast (continental). It wasn't anything spectacular but what do you expect for a free breakfast at only 65 Euro a night. It was crowded and may have to share a table but they try their best to accommodate everyone. I had a rough night sleeping due to loud traffic outside and too hot to close the windows (no A/C) but when we told the man (I think he owns this place) at the front desk...he got us a fan and brought it to our room himself. We REALLY appreciated that he did that for us. They remembered our room # and name which was a nice jesture. It's walking distance to the some attractions and close to the "hop on and off bus". Close to many restaurants and laundry mat is across the street. Definitely worth your money if you are looking at a decent 2-3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Great Location and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: AdamBenedict
Reviews.Content: Free Wifi and location to Central Staion attracted me first.Management and Proprietor were very considerate on a mix up about booking.Its better than its 2 star rating and lots of rooms refurbished.They are currently doing the outside.Only critique is limited breakfast,no cheese included!

Reviews.Title: “beeten up in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 123456789t
Reviews.Content: do not stay in this hotel Giorgina or the one connected to called the Hotel Acropoli i got beat up here by the night porter because i asked about the broken vending machines

Reviews.Title: “Not for the picky”
Reviews.Author: Savonarola
Reviews.Content: Giorgina is a cheap hotel near the Termini station. That means the surrounding area can be somewhat dangerous at night. Photos did not match what was seen over the internet. I got a large triple room that was not so bad and looked clean. Bathroom was small and the shower got all the floor wet. Noisy at night. Breakfast was poor and the aforementioned orange juice is indeed bizarre and tastes like it was pressed by the time the Roman Empire was crumbling. I wouldn't recommend this place, but I've seen worse.

Reviews.Title: “plain hotel”
Reviews.Author: Polaco1212
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at the Giorgina in September 2006 for a week. As far as the check-in is concerned I was satisfied, because it was done fastly and without any problems. The rooms are bright and have simple but sufficient furniture. So, everything was nice and I thought that we had luck for a two star hotel since even the bathroom was clean. However, the hotel is not as "good" as it seems at first sight because later we saw that there was mould at the ceiling of the bathroom. Furthermore, it is impossible to take a shower without having the bathroom and all your cothes totally wet, which is very pesky. The breakfast is simple, just jam and rolls. Please beware of the juice they offer... it is not tasty and I was not sure where it really comes from. The dinner we booked for the whole week was in a restaurant in the street of the hotel and it was actually okay. The staff there were very pleasant in comparison to that at breakfast and at the reception. In general, the hotel has a really good location regarding the transport facilities (250 metres to main station termini) but the streets are noisy, dirty and the area is dangerous in the evening. Finally, there was one thing that made me suspicious: Where was the fire exit? I would recommend the hotel only to people who are not very demanding, who do not go out for clubbing (hotel closes at 2 a.m.) and who just want to visit the beatiful sights. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare...”
Reviews.Author: SeattleWeekender
Reviews.Content: I booked Giorgina because 1) it was a budget hotel centrally located in Rome 2) we aren’t picky travelers and ask only that a hotel is clean, safe and a good place to get a decent night’s sleep and 3) reviews and pictures posted on another travel website looked favorable. What a terrible surprise when we arrived to find that the hotel was truly nightmarish. The street noise was absolutely awful and the street itself undesirable (and it is possible to find a good hotel near Termini no matter what anyone tells you). The elevator was broken (which the staff didn’t tell us) so we had to haul our luggage up 5 long flights of stairs. The hallways were like something out of a horror film, I kid you not. What a slummy building. Once upstairs, the room was NOTHING like the photos we saw online. The furniture and colors were essentially the same, but the room was dark, filthy, and the lights didn’t work save for one scary institutional looking thing on the wall above the bed. The toilet didn’t really flush well, there were hairs and other things I won’t mention on the bathroom fixtures, and the bedspread was grubby. When we asked to change rooms, we were given keys to a marginally better room with two twins, but the street noise in that room was worse (if that’s even possible) the room was still dirty, and the doors to the closet were broken so we couldn’t access pillows and blankets. When I saw two large bugs run across the floor and into a hole in the wall, I decided to just change hotels rather than spoil our time in Rome. Although the reservation document listed no cancellation policy under the section provided, the very rude front desk clerk yelled at me, would not listen to my grievances about the state of the rooms, insisted that he was entitled to charge us for the room and actually said “If I can take your money, I will.” You can find better hotels in Rome for this price. For the sake of your journey, avoid Giorgina.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't reccomend Giorgina”
Reviews.Author: Tuki
Reviews.Content: The best feature of the Giorgina is its close proximity to the Termini (Railway Station) if that is what you need. The noise at night from the street is unreal. We asked for the toilet to be fixed as the flushing system was just about impossible to operate but nothing happened. The breakfast, while there was plenty of it was not fresh and we didn't exactly appreciate a staff member eating her breakfast as she served the guests. We always check out the fire exits in these old hotels and in fact couldn't initially find the door out from the floor we were on and then discovered the exit sign was on the rear of the door! The staff were friendly. We wouldn't go there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Giorgina
HotelInfo.Address: Via Principe Amedeo 69, 185 Rome, Italy
